title: borsaicin
author: borsaicin
content: Bitmex closed my account and won't tell me why. It does not respond to e-mails, I am worried about my money.https://hizliresim.com/h213vcr

comments.author: Oshosondy
comments.body: There are many other exchanges that you can use.The problem is if they do not allow you to withdraw your money. Were you able to withdraw your coins or the account is empty? Other exchanges that you can use with their trustscore: https://www.coingecko.com/en/exchangesNot you key not your coin.

comments.author: EarnOnVictor
comments.body: Quote from: borsaicin on September 04, 2023, 09:44:45 AMBitmex closed my account and won't tell me why. It does not respond to e-mails, I am worried about my money.What am I seeing??? This is bad, but you should have elaborated on it. How much do you have in the account and how fair are the transactions you made with it? "Not your key, Not your coin" has played again here, it's another lesson.Regardless, if an exchange could lock an account without a due reason for doing so, then they are not worth using irrespective of their reason. I don't have an account with them, and you have given me another reason with the image provided not to have an account with them ever.

comments.body: Maybe you should make a much detailed scam accusation, including all the email exchanges between you and Bitmex support, how much is locked up in the account etc. Something tells me there is more to this ban, but only you and Bitmex know that. So help us understand what's happening.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: At first did you do KYC before depositing on the exchange?Did you register with VPN and after registration you forgot to use the VPN to continue login your account?Possibly there must have been something wrong with your account because I do not see any reason why your account should be blocked just like that.OP it would be nice and in my your own interest to provide concrete information and evidence to back up your claims as this chat you provided is not enough to justify this situation. There must have been a breach somewhere else that warranted this actions from this third party organisation because it would not be making any sense to closing am account without any strong and tangible reasons.

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: CryptSafe on September 07, 2023, 11:10:23 AMAt first did you do KYC before depositing on the exchange?Initially. It was possible to create an account or multiple accounts on Bitmex and trade without every going through any sort of KYC verification. All one needed was to verify the email address, but on 28 August 2020, everything would completely change after announcing that every user would have to complete mandatory KYC verification on registering or before trading on the platform.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: borsaicin on September 07, 2023, 08:26:39 AMNo, there's no violation. If there are, it's better if they explain it. From the image you linked to us, Bitmex did say you breached their terms of service so there is a violation. Perhaps, you were truly at fault -- whether you did it knowingly or not. However, we don't know the specifics so it could go both ways really. CEx do rely on suspicions so I wouldn't be surpised if it's something dumb or a false positive.In any case, it's unlikely that they will explain the cause throughly. With CEx's it's either they don't tell the specifics or give a vague reasoning which as user, I know, sucks. Most of these exchanges also have clause/s in their terms of service indicating they may not notify you the exact reason for cases like this.So my advise is to focus your energy in getting your funds out. See if you could request to delete your personal data with them as well -- i know we have to rely on trust with this but it's better than nothing.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Quote from: borsaicin on September 09, 2023, 09:17:59 AMHow can I contact the licence providers. My account was approved 2 years I opened a smooth transaction. Bitmex is based in the Seychelles[1], exchange licenses are generally usually issued by local financial services regulatory agencies. But, I think it doesn't help much, and is too complicated.Your problem is the subject of a legal dispute that requires court resolution, it could be that bitmex has a valid reason why your account was terminated. The license won't be revoked that simply.You're better off contacting a lawyer if your money is large enough.1. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BitMEX

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Unfortunately, this is a common practice among online businesses. They close your account and seize your money but will never tell you the exact reason why they did so. They will just tell you you violated their terms and refer you to their ToS page and there isn't much you can do about it. None of us here can know if you really did breach the terms or no, so we can't comment on that. But what is unacceptable is seizing your money. Even if you are at fault, they can close your account but they should let you withdraw your money.
